channel.title: git on Loner Bytes
channel.description: Recent content in git on Loner Bytes

item.title: Learnings of the Day 13/12
item.description: Git/Github Learning Summary Basics Git: Version control system created by Linus Torvalds in 2005. Repository: Tracks changes in a codebase and consists of commits (snapshots of files). Branch: An alternate history for code. Merge: Combines branches into a single codebase. Commands $ git init: Initializes a repository. $ git add .: Adds changes to the staged area. $ git commit -m "msg": Commits changes with a message. $ git branch alternate-universe: Creates a new branch.

item.title: Learnings of the Day 10/12
item.description: Problems Faced: 1. Git Initialization and Pushing: Issue: Facing errors while initializing Git and pushing to a new GitHub repository. Solution: Resolved by reinitializing Git, adding and committing files, and pushing to the repository. 2. GitHub Actions Workflow: Issue: Difficulty in setting up a GitHub Actions workflow for deployment. Solution: Provided guidance on creating a workflow file (deploy.yml) for deploying HTML, CSS, and JS files. 3. GitHub Actions Deprecation Warning: Issue: Received a warning about the deprecation of Node.
